org.castor.spring.orm

Class JDOManagerUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.castor.spring.orm.JDOManagerUtils

  • public abstract class JDOManagerUtils
extends Object
    Helper class featuring methods for Castor CastorManager handling, allowing for reuse of Database instances within transactions.

    Used by CastorTemplate, CastorInterceptor, and CastorTransactionManager. Can also be used directly in application code, e.g. in combination with CastorInterceptor.

    Since:
    20.05.2005
    Author:
    Werner Guttmann
    See Also:
    CastorTemplate, CastorInterceptor, CastorTransactionManager

    • Field Detail

      • DATABASE_SYNCHRONIZATION_ORDER

        public static final int DATABASE_SYNCHRONIZATION_ORDER
        Order value for TransactionSynchronization objects that clean up JDO Databases. Return DataSourceUtils.CONNECTION_SYNCHRONIZATION_ORDER - 100 to execute Database cleanup before JDBC Connection cleanup, if any.
        See Also:
        DataSourceUtils.CONNECTION_SYNCHRONIZATION_ORDER, Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • JDOManagerUtils

        public JDOManagerUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • newJdbcExceptionTranslator

        public static org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLExceptionTranslator newJdbcExceptionTranslator(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager jdoManager)
        Create an appropriate SQLExceptionTranslator for the given JDOManager. If a DataSource is found, create a SQLErrorCodeSQLExceptionTranslator for the DataSource; else, fall back to a SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.
        Parameters:
        jdoManager - the JDOManager to create the translator for
        Returns:
        the SQLExceptionTranslator
        See Also:
        JDOManager.getConnectionFactory(), SQLErrorCodeSQLExceptionTranslator, SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator

      • getDatabase

        public static org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database getDatabase(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager jdoManager,
                                         boolean allowCreate)
                                                  throws org.springframework.dao.DataAccessResourceFailureException,
                                                         IllegalStateException
        Get a JDO Database via the given factory. Is aware of a corresponding Database bound to the current thread, for example when using CastorTransactionManager. Will create a new Database else, if allowCreate is true.
        Parameters:
        jdoManager - JDOManager to create the Database instance with
        allowCreate - if a new Database should be created if no thread-bound found
        Returns:
        the Database
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessResourceFailureException - if the Database couldn't be created
        IllegalStateException - if no thread-bound Database found and allowCreate false

      • getDatabase

        public static org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database getDatabase(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager jdoManager,
                                         boolean allowCreate,
                                         boolean allowSynchronization)
                                                  throws org.springframework.dao.DataAccessResourceFailureException,
                                                         IllegalStateException
        Get a JDO Database via the given factory. Is aware of a corresponding Database bound to the current thread, for example when using CastorTransactionManager. Will create a new Database else, if allowCreate is true.
        Parameters:
        jdoManager - JDOManager to create the Databae with
        allowCreate - if a new Database should be created if no thread-bound found
        allowSynchronization - if a new JDO Database is supposed to be registered with transaction synchronization (if synchronization is active). This will always be true for typical data access code.
        Returns:
        the Database
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessResourceFailureException - if the Database couldn't be created
        IllegalStateException - if no thread-bound Database found and allowCreate false

      • applyTransactionTimeout

        public static void applyTransactionTimeout(org.exolab.castor.jdo.OQLQuery query,
                           org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager jdoManager,
                           CastorDialect castorDialect)
                                    throws org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException
        Apply the current transaction timeout, if any, to the given Castor JDO OQLQuery object.
        Parameters:
        query - the Castor JDO OQLQuery object
        jdoManager - JDO JDOManager that the OQLQuery was created for
        castorDialect - the CastorDialect to use for applying a query timeout (must not be null)
        Throws:
        org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException - If the timeout cannot be allied to the OQL query.
        See Also:
        CastorDialect.applyQueryTimeout(org.exolab.castor.jdo.OQLQuery, int)

      • convertJdoAccessException

        public static org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException convertJdoAccessException(org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException ex)
        Convert the given PersistenceException to an appropriate exception from the org.springframework.dao hierarchy.

        The most important cases like object not found or optimistic verification failure are covered here. For more fine-granular conversion, CastorAccessor and CastorTransactionManager support sophisticated translation of exceptions via a CastorDialect.

        Parameters:
        ex - PeristenceException that occured
        Returns:
        the corresponding DataAccessException instance
        See Also:
        CastorAccessor.convertJdoAccessException(org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException), CastorTransactionManager.convertJdoAccessException(org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException), CastorDialect.translateException(org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException)

      • closeDatabaseIfNecessary

        public static void closeDatabaseIfNecessary(org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database database,
                            org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager jdoManager)
        Close the given Database, created via the given factory, if it isn't bound to the thread.
        Parameters:
        database - Database to close
        jdoManager - JDOManager that the Database was created with
